Plastic

Plastic Age

In 1907, Leo Hendrik Baekeland

invented Bakelite, the first fully synthetic plastic, which was made from phenol and

formaldehyde. This new plastic was strong, heat-resistant, and could be molded into a variety of shapes, which made it very useful in a wide range of applications.

I am MD

I am SM

I am XS

From the 1950s to the 1970s, only a small

amount of plastic was produced,

and as a result, plastic waste was relatively manageable.

However between the 1970s and the 1990s,

plastic waste generation more than tripled,

reflecting a similar rise in plastic production.

In the early 2000s, the amount of plastic waste

we generated rose more in a single decade than

it had in the previous 40 years.

In the early 2000s, the amount of plastic waste

we generated rose more in a single decade than

it had in the previous 40 years.

How Plastic enters the ocean

Gobal Primary plastic production

From factory and Industries-packaging industry

Gobal Plastic production

From Urban Cities -mostly from product and thier packaging

Coastal Plastic Waste

From Home ,Buliding

Mismanaged costal plastic waste

The waste that is not properly handled,such as

waste that has not been recycled or reduced

Plastic inputs to the oceans

Waste produced in the coastal region and rubbish that ends up in the ocean

Plastic in surface waters:10,000s to 100,000s tonnes
